titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the George Watkins Biographical Sketch circa 1940
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Jodi Allison-Bunnell
titlestmt.sponsor: Funding for encoding this finding aid was provided through a grant awarded by the National Endowment for the Humanities.

publicationstmt.publisher: Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library, The University of Montana--Missoula

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Jodi Allison-Bunnell 2004

repository.corpname: University of Montana, Mansfield Library, Archives and Special Collections

did.abstract: The collection consists of a biographical sketch of George S. Watkins offering a picture of life in Madison County and Virginia City, Montana, between 1864 and the 1890s.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of a biographical sketch of George S. Watkins by an unknown author that was written about 1940 based mostly on letters written from Watkins to his family. The biography offers a picture of life in Madison County and Virginia City, Montana, between 1864 and the 1890s. There are no notes on the location of the original letters. There is a single page of explanatory notes, possibly added by Mary Elrod Ferguson, librarian at The University of Montana.

accessrestrict.p: Researchers must use collection in accordance with the policies of Archives and Special Collections, the Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library, and the University of Montana--Missoula.

userestrict.p: Researchers are responsible for using in accordance with 17 U.S.C. and any other applicable statutes. Copyright not transferred to the University of Montana.

prefercite.p: [Name of document], George Watkins Biographical Sketch, Archives and Special Collections, The University of Montana-Missoula.

acqinfo.p: The provenance of this collection is unknown.

processinfo.p: The actions of the original processors are unknown; the collection was numbered SC 4. In 1998, the collection was re-numbered as Mss 017 and re-described; the finding aid was encoded in 2004.

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.
